questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. As the architecture evolves, the assets in the Solutions Continuum progress towards a (n) _____

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
39.4.2 Solutions Continuum



Figure 39-3: Solutions Continuum
"Moving to the right" on the Solutions Continuum is focused on providing solutions value (i.e., foundation solutions provide value in creating common systems solutions; common systems solutions are used to create industry solutions; and industry solutions are used to create organization-specific solutions). "Moving to the left" on the Solutions Continuum is focused on addressing enterprise needs.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap39.html

Correct Answer 

Architecture Continuum
A part of the Enterprise Continuum. A repository of architectural elements with increasing detail and specialization.
Note:
This Continuum begins with foundational definitions like reference models, core strategies, and basic building blocks. From there it spans to Industry Architectures and all the way to an Organization-Specific Architecture.

questions.question_text: In which ADM phase are the business principles, business goals and strategic drivers first validated?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While these are mentioned as being identified in the Preliminary Phase, they are actually validated in Phase A. 

"ensure that the existing definitions are current, and clarify any areas of ambiguity."

Selected Answer: A
5.2.2 Non-Architectural Inputs
Board strategies and board business plans, business strategy, IT strategy, business principles, business goals, and business drivers, when pre-existing

Selected Answer: B
http://www.togaf.com/admref/_chap05.html

Correct Answer -- Phase A

Ref Link : https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap06.html#tag_06_03

choices.C: A tool for calculating detailed cost estimates
choices.D: A tool for project planning the implementation activities ActualTests.com
choices.E: A tool for selling the benefits of the proposed capability to stakeholders
choices.B: An evaluation tool to select vendors to conduct a proof of concept demonstration

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
6.1 Objectives
The objectives of Phase A are to:
* Develop a high-level aspirational vision of the capabilities and business value to be delivered as a result of the proposed Enterprise Architecture
* Obtain approval for a Statement of Architecture Work that defines a program of works to develop and deploy the architecture outlined in the Architecture Vision

questions.question_text: Which one of the following best describes a primary use of the Architecture Vision document?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Objectives
The objectives of Phase B are:
* To describe the Baseline Business Architecture
* To develop a Target Business Architecture, describing the product and/or service strategy, and the organizational, functional, process, information, and geographic aspects of the business environment, based on the business principles, business goals, and strategic drivers
* To analyze the gaps between the Baseline and Target Business Architectures
* To select the relevant architecture viewpoints that will enable the architect to demonstrate how the stakeholder concerns are addressed in the Business Architecture
* To select the relevant tools and techniques to be used in association with the selected viewpoints

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf8-doc/arch/chap06.html

Selected Answer: A
because NOT the Strategic

Correct Answer -- Option A 

Reference :

The objectives of Phase B are to:

Develop the Target Business Architecture that describes how the enterprise needs to operate to achieve the business goals, and respond to the strategic drivers set out in the Architecture Vision, in a way that addresses the Statement of Architecture Work and stakeholder concerns
Identify candidate Architecture Roadmap components based upon gaps between the Baseline and Target Business Architectures

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an objective for Phase B, Business Architecture?
Which of the following is an objective of Phase B, Business Architecture?

choices.E: To maximize the business value from the architecture
choices.D: To finalize the Architecture Vision and Architecture Definition documents
choices.C: To develop a Target Technology Architecture to support the business
choices.A: To confirm the ability of the enterprise to undergo change
choices.B: To demonstrate how stakeholder concerns are addressed in the Business Architecture

discussion.content:
7.1 Objectives
The objectives of Phase B are to:
Develop the Target Business Architecture that describes how the enterprise needs to operate to achieve the business goals, and respond to the strategic drivers set out in the Architecture Vision, in a way that addresses the Statement of Architecture Work and stakeholder concerns
Identify candidate Architecture Roadmap components based upon gaps between the Baseline and Target Business Architectures

Selected Answer: B
